individual_metadata.synopsis: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The input contains only one session (with an empty string as its key). Since there are no additional sessions, there are no dependencies, ordering, or exclusiveness constraints to deduce.

49.speaker: Roah Moonglow
49.text: Reckon we've said all there is to say, eh? But don't worry - the Network'll be in touch soon.
49.context: NodeContext: Icy, faux-friendly - she and her organisation are sworn, if polite, enemies of yours now

55.speaker: Roah Moonglow
55.text: Ah - need something then, do you?
55.context: NodeContext: Tone is 'well look who we have here?' This response is if the player refused to trade with her previously out of principle.

10.speaker: Roah Moonglow
10.context: NodeContext: Tone is 'that wasn't so hard, was it?'

85.speaker: Roah Moonglow
85.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

72.speaker: Roah Moonglow
72.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.

44.speaker: Roah Moonglow
44.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
44.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Your insignia; I've seen it before - in the Underdark.

53.speaker: Roah Moonglow
53.text: Aye, so you have. It's one place the Zhentarim can trade openly, thank the gods.
53.context: NodeContext: Pleasantly surprised at your recognition of her. (Pronounced z-HENT-ah-rim)

32.speaker: Roah Moonglow
32.text: Folk up here like to quiver over right and wrong - until the coin starts clinking, anyway.
32.context: NodeContext: A hint of contempt - her organisation is reviled for dealing in drugs, weapons etc, but it's often the same people who are buying from them.

84.speaker: Roah Moonglow
84.text: It's just business. If there was money in being good, the Zhentarim would be pure as paladins.
84.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, bemused at how infamous her organisation is for dealing in the black market. If people weren't buying, they wouldn't be selling./

66.speaker: Player
66.text: What business does a Zhent have with goblins?

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I have no interest in trading with a Zhent.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Your insignia; I've seen it before - in the Underdark.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Your insignia; I've seen it before - in the Underdark.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

65.speaker: Roah Moonglow
65.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
65.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *You recognise the crest she bears - the winged serpent of the Zhentarim.*
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera should show Crest of Zhentarim she is wearing

20.speaker: Player
20.text: You're no normal trader, are you? You're part of the Black Network.

0.speaker: Roah Moonglow
0.text: Half-right, sharp-eyes - a Zhent is a normal trader. Just a matter of what's for sale.
0.context: NodeContext: Impressed and appraising the player - but correcting your assumption. (Pronounced z-HENT)

75.speaker: Roah Moonglow
75.text: Weapons and other... exotic goods, true enough. But most of all, we offer discretion.
75.context: NodeContext: Explaining her trade, the benefits of dealing with her organisation. She sells illicit goods but she sees it as a trade just like any other, just a matter of perspective

2.speaker: Roah Moonglow
2.text: No judgement, no right and wrong - just good deals and bad. That a problem for you?
2.context: NodeContext: Affable, reasonable - laying out the situation for you and inviting you to take it or leave it.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I killed your friends at Waukeen's Rest - is that a problem?

37.speaker: Roah Moonglow
37.text: ... assuming I believe you - not really, no. Never much liked Zarys, truth be told.
37.context: NodeContext: Smiling, dangerous. You've just goaded her with the fact that you killed members of her organisation. She's passionless when it comes to business, but even so her organisation is known for exacting vengeance on anyone who harms a member.

36.speaker: Roah Moonglow
36.text: But the Black Network pays like for like. They - we - will be after you now.
36.context: NodeContext: Warning you, stating a fact but almost pitying you.

48.speaker: Roah Moonglow
48.text: But for now, I see no reason we can't make a civilised trade. I reckon you'll be wanting some steel.
48.context: NodeContext: A cold threat behind her words. You've made a huge mistake and you're too stupid to even realize, but you're so little of a threat to her that she may as well trade with you one last time.

90.speaker: Roah Moonglow
90.text: Be seeing you. Sooner than you'd like, I expect.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I've already done business with your kind - beneath Waukeen's Rest.

29.speaker: Roah Moonglow
29.text: Bit quieter, if you please. This crowd just burned that inn to the ground, you might recall.
29.context: NodeContext: Hushing you, looking around - you've said that others from her organisaton have run afoul of the very goblins all around you.

64.speaker: Roah Moonglow
64.text: But good - that means Zarys and her little operation weren't found.
64.context: NodeContext: ZAR-iss. Thoughtful, getting your measure again - you've proven more capable than she'd have assumed

93.speaker: Roah Moonglow
93.text: Seems you're a friend of the family. That warrants a discount - a small one.
93.context: NodeContext: Coming to a decision about you - she'll give you a discount seeing as you helped her friends out.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: No problem at all. Let me see your wares.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: What business do you have in a goblin camp?

19.speaker: Roah Moonglow
19.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
19.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

80.speaker: Roah Moonglow
80.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
80.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

81.speaker: Roah Moonglow
81.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
81.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: It's slaves you're buying - not prisoners.

21.speaker: Roah Moonglow
21.text: Oh dry your eyes, Ilmater. It's me or a goblin cookpot - I know which I'd choose.
21.context: NodeContext: Scornful but not overly so - she's more bored of your moralising than anything. Ilmater (ihl-MAY-ter) is a god of compassion and martyrdom. She has no time for your bleeding heart - she's all pragmatism.

15.speaker: Roah Moonglow
15.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
15.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: What do the goblins want smokepowder for?

70.speaker: Roah Moonglow
70.text: Ask the drow they're all bowing to. That glint in her eye is bad news for someone.
70.context: NodeContext: Shrug - it's not her problem, but she pities whoever the drow is planning to deal with.

63.speaker: Roah Moonglow
63.text: Not my concern, so long as I'm paid. Speaking of - something to trade, or what?
63.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, getting back to the matter at hand. She's used to minding her own business - and everything is just business to her.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: What do you know about Moonrise Towers?

31.speaker: Roah Moonglow
31.text: All I need to - there's an awful lot of folk flowing that way, and coin is sure to follow.
31.context: NodeContext: She doesn't share your curiosity - but she sees the opportunity for business in Moonrise.

40.speaker: Roah Moonglow
40.text: Might have to find my faith and see this Absolute for myself, eh?
40.context: NodeContext: Speculative, joking - she'll happily pretend to be relgious if it means making a deal

46.speaker: Roah Moonglow
46.text: Still some deals to be done here, though - you want to trade, or what?
46.context: NodeContext: Eyeing you up, bringing you back to the topic at hand

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I knew the Zhent were heartless, but the goblin slave trade? Really?

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I'm not interested in trading with a Zhent.

69.speaker: Roah Moonglow
69.text: Suit yourself. You'll be back when you have need - just make sure you have coin, too.
69.context: NodeContext: Not bothered one way or the other. She's bored of moral posturing about her trade, and she'll happily do a deal once you get over yourself

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You Zhentarim tend to trade in misery - that why you're at a goblin camp?

97.speaker: Roah Moonglow
97.text: Ah, the family friend! Need something?
97.context: NodeContext: Welcoming you back, you've done her a good turn.

68.speaker: Roah Moonglow
68.context: NodeContext: Tone is 'that wasn't so hard, was it?'
